articles.title: Toothbrushes and Showerheads Swarm With Unknown Viruses – And That’s Good News - SciTechDaily
articles.description: A recent study has found that common bathroom fixtures like showerheads and toothbrushes are teeming with bacteriophages, viruses that attack bacteria, not humans. This discovery offers promising avenues for treating resistant bacterial infections and undersc…
articles.content: Discover the hidden biodiversity within your home: a Northwestern University study reveals that showerheads and toothbrushes host a diverse array of viruses, known as bacteriophages, which predominan… [+5453 chars]
